components.data:
Before we continue, determine if you have single end or paired end files. If you have two files per SRR number, you have paired end reads. Otherwise, you have single end reads. 

 

1. If you have single end reads proceed to step 10.

2. If you have paired end reads, skip to step 11.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Before we continue, determine if you have single end or paired end files. If you have two files per SRR number, you have paired end reads. Otherwise, you have single end reads. 

 

1. If you have single end reads proceed to step 10.

2. If you have paired end reads, skip to step 11.

components.data:
Assembly script for PAIRED END FILES

 

Create a script called run-assembly.sh
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Assembly script for PAIRED END FILES

 

Create a script called run-assembly.sh

source_data.name:
#!/bin/bash

#PBS -W group_list=bh_class
#PBS -q windfall
#PBS -l select=1:ncpus=20:mem=40gb
#PBS -l pvmem=38gb
#PBS -l walltime=24:00:00
#PBS -l cput=48:00:00
#PBS -M netid@email.arizona.edu
#PBS -m bea

FASTA_DIR='/rsgrps/bh_class/username/fasta'
ASSEM_DIR='/rsgrps/bh_class/username/assembly'
MIN_CONTIG_LEN=500
OUT_DIR='/rsgrps/bh_class/username/assembly/megahit-out'

cd $ASSEM_DIR

R1s=`ls $FASTA_DIR/*_1.fasta | python -c 'import sys; print ",".join([x.strip() for x in sys.stdin.readlines()])'`
R2s=`ls $FASTA_DIR/*_2.fasta | python -c 'import sys; print ",".join([x.strip() for x in sys.stdin.readlines()])'`

megahit -1 $R1s -2 $R2s --preset meta-sensitive --min-contig-len $MIN_CONTIG_LEN -o $OUT_DIR -t 12

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 10 of Assembly with Megahit
source_data.annotation: OUT_DIR does NOT need to be created prior to running this script. Megahit will make the directory on its own.
source_data.thread_text: OUT_DIR does NOT need to be created prior to running this script. Megahit will make the directory on its own.
source_data.body: OUT_DIR does NOT need to be created prior to running this script. Megahit will make the directory on its own.

components.data:
Assembly script for SINGLE END FILES

 

Create a script called run-assembly.sh
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Assembly script for SINGLE END FILES

 

Create a script called run-assembly.sh

source_data.name:
#!/bin/bash

#PBS -W group_list=bh_class
#PBS -q windfall
#PBS -l select=1:ncpus=20:mem=40gb
#PBS -l pvmem=38gb
#PBS -l walltime=24:00:00
#PBS -l cput=48:00:00
#PBS -M netid@email.arizona.edu
#PBS -m bea

FASTA_DIR='/rsgrps/bh_class/username/fasta'
ASSEM_DIR='/rsgrps/bh_class/username/assembly'
MIN_CONTIG_LEN=500
OUT_DIR='/rsgrps/bh_class/username/assembly/megahit-out'

cd $ASSEM_DIR

SINGLEs=`ls $FASTA_DIR/*.fasta | python -c 'import sys; print ",".join([x.strip() for x in sys.stdin.readlines()])'`

megahit -r $SINGLEs --preset meta-sensitive --min-contig-len $MIN_CONTIG_LEN -o $OUT_DIR -t 12

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 9 of Assembly with Megahit
source_data.annotation: OUT_DIR does NOT need to be created prior to running this script. Megahit will make the directory on its own.
source_data.thread_text: OUT_DIR does NOT need to be created prior to running this script. Megahit will make the directory on its own.
source_data.body: OUT_DIR does NOT need to be created prior to running this script. Megahit will make the directory on its own.

$ qsub -e std-err/ -o std-out/ run-assembly.sh

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 7 of Assembly Stats with MetaQuast
source_data.annotation:
Important: You must scp your contigs to your local machine before you can upload.

 

$ scp username@sftp.hpc.arizona.edu:/rsgrps/bh_class/username/assembly/megahit-out/final.contigs.fa .

components.data: Once your upload is complete, click on the "Apps" button found on the left.

components.data: Search for "MetaQuast". Click on MetaQuast-4.3 (denovo based)
components.name: Description

components.data: Under the "Fasta file(s)" tab, select the newly uploaded final.contigs.fa file. This is the only parameter that needs to change. Click "Launch Analysis".
components.name: Description

components.data: Input the following line into your .bashrc file:
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Input the following line into your .bashrc file:

source_data.name: export PATH=/rsgrps/bh_class/bin:$PATH
source_data.description: This will allow us to execute tools found in /rsgrps/bh_class/bin without specifying the path name.

components.data: Save and close the .bashrc file
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Save and close the .bashrc file
